timeline.message: Deserialize config into object and use object throughout Capacitor
Use new Config object to initialize for embedded
Config is immutable and can be created programatically with a builder for embedded
Plugin config separation, refactor, comments + more
deprecated direct config object accessors and added plugin versions
Merge branch 'android-config' of github.com:ionic-team/capacitor into android-config
Changed config to use context and get the asset manager itself
Allow fragment users to set config

timeline.bodyText: Why does webContentsDebuggingEnabled get special treatment? Can this constructor just be public CapConfig(Context context)?
timeline.author: imhoffd

replies.bodyText: yeah, context is enough to get the debuggable value like this (context.getApplicationInfo().flags & ApplicationInfo.FLAG_DEBUGGABLE) != 0;
replies.author: jcesarmobile

timeline.bodyText: Should all this be happening in the constructor? Maybe we can take this opportunity to practice some separation of concerns. The iOS side now has a few different classes that separate "loading from a JSON file" and "containing the configuration".
timeline.author: imhoffd

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for the feedback. I have removed the public constructor for CapConfig and replaced it with a method fromFile that can be used to create an instance of CapConfig from the JSON config file.
I moved the JSON file loading to the FileUtils class since it involved reading a file and seemed appropriate there (and its also reused elsewhere in the core).
replies.author: carlpoole

timeline.bodyText: I think this should follow the getter pattern: getHTML5Mode() or isHTML5Mode()
timeline.author: imhoffd

timeline.bodyText: I think these should follow the setter pattern: setHTML5Mode(), setServerURL(), etc.
timeline.author: imhoffd

replies.bodyText: They dont need to, but it seems Android does that so I'll copy their style
replies.author: carlpoole

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we should add these methods here. Is the intended usage this.bridge.config.getPluginString() in the Plugin class? If so, it would be a nicer API if it was just this.config.getString() (or this.pluginConfig.getString()), etc. We could make a PluginConfig class to keep classes smaller and purposeful.
timeline.author: imhoffd

replies.bodyText:
I split the Plugin JSON config into its own class and moved the methods there also. Since the CapConfig and PluginsConfig class used similar JSON parsing methods, I centralized those in a new class called JSONUtils that both Config classes may use.
Use example:
config.getPluginsConfiguration().getString("myplugin","temperature");
Thoughts?
replies.author: carlpoole

replies.bodyText: Looking good so far--check out my latest comment: #3778 (comment)

replies.bodyText: After discussing, the breaking change is acceptable since the use case for using this method included Embedded and edge cases. Will document in upgrade guide. Added some javadoc to highlight that an instance of CapConfig is used instead of a JSONObject.
